title: 'Attack will bring strong response': Iran pushes back against Trump a day before Geneva talks
content: Iran has strongly refuted US President Trump's accusations of rebuilding nuclear and missile capabilities, calling them "big lies." Ahead of crucial talks in Geneva, Iranian officials stated that "honourable diplomacy" could lead to success, but warned against confrontation. Tehran insists its dignity and mutual interests must be respected during negotiations.

title: Beyond coding: Why Anthropic‚Äôs CEO says human skills matter more in the AI era
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei advises students and young professionals to pivot towards human-centered skills, steering clear of rapidly AI-dominated fields like software engineering and math. He emphasizes tasks involving relating to people and suggests focusing on areas like the semiconductor space, which blends physical and traditional engineering.

title: Can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup semifinal after loss to England?
content: England secured a T20 World Cup 2026 semi-final spot after a thrilling victory over Pakistan. Captain Harry Brook's maiden T20I century was the highlight, guiding England home in a tense chase. Pakistan's qualification now hinges on other results, facing a challenging path to the last four.

title: 'Huge mistake': Bill Gates admits affairs with Russian women; apologises for Epstein link
content: Bill Gates has apologised to Gates Foundation staff for his association with Jeffrey Epstein, admitting it was a "huge mistake" that harmed the organisation's reputation. While asserting he "did nothing illicit," Gates acknowledged meetings continued after Epstein's conviction and that his ties helped Epstein "burnish his reputation." He also admitted to two affairs during his marriage.

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice won‚Äôt work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: Home, smart home: How AI is rewiring India's housing sector
content: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing India's real estate, from smart apartment features like biometric access and predictive maintenance to enhanced commercial design and lease analysis. Wealthy, tech-savvy homebuyers are driving demand for intelligent homes, while AI tools are also aiding architects and developers in planning and cost-saving.

title: 'It was just too much': Manjrekar tears into Gautam Gambhir's tactics
content: Sanjay Manjrekar criticized Gautam Gambhir's tactics after India's heavy T20 World Cup loss to South Africa. He questioned promoting Washington Sundar to number five, calling him an 'all-in-one' solution for batting and bowling issues. Manjrekar also highlighted the team's struggle with slower balls, urging focus on this area before their crucial match against Zimbabwe.

title: Nasscom event: TCS CEO reframes AI debate amid IT sector jitters
content: TCS CEO K Krithivasan views AI as an opportunity, encouraging employees to leverage AI tools for faster, cheaper service delivery, even if it impacts revenue. This stance comes amid investor concerns over AI's disruption of India's IT sector, with recent AI advancements causing significant market value erosion.

title: 'The Kerala Story 2': Kerala HC orders makers to not release film's rights
content: The Kerala High Court has ordered the makers of 'The Kerala Story 2' to halt the release of its rights pending a ruling on petitions challenging its certification. The court questioned the U/A certification, deeming petitioners' concerns "probably genuine" and urging producers to wait for the verdict.

title: Told to pay, BJP MLA Chaudhary Babulal‚Äôs son slaps Agra toll plaza employee
content: Son of Fatehpur Sikri MLA Chaudhary Babulal allegedly slapped a toll employee at Raybha toll plaza after being asked to pay the toll fee due to a missing FASTag. The incident, captured on CCTV, was reportedly resolved amicably with the toll worker declining to file a complaint. The MLA, however, alleged abusive behavior from the toll staff.

title: 'I would never want to coach in Pakistan': Former England captain's blunt take
content: Babar Azam's struggles at the T20 World Cup are under intense scrutiny, with his batting role and form drawing criticism. Former England captain Michael Vaughan, however, believes coach Mike Hesson has navigated Pakistan's complex cricket politics well, suggesting Babar's anchoring style suits Sri Lankan conditions if others play aggressively around him.

title: NCERT row: Textbook with chapter on 'corruption in judiciary' pulled off shelves
content: NCERT has withdrawn its new Class 8 Social Science textbook. This action follows the inclusion of a section on corruption in the judiciary. The Supreme Court intervened after the matter was raised. Chief Justice of India Surya Kant stated the institution would not allow defamation. Senior lawyers highlighted the selective focus on the judiciary.

title: Cardi B‚Äôs tour clapback sparks buzz as fans think she‚Äôs sending a clear message to Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B shut down critics who doubted her commitment to the Little Miss Drama Tour after becoming a new mom. She highlighted sold-out shows and said she takes performing seriously, treating concerts like celebrations with fans. Sharing four children, including one with NFL star Stefon Diggs, the rapper continues to balance motherhood and music while proving her professionalism on stage.

title: Where to invest Rs 1 lakh - gold, silver, stocks, mutual funds? Experts decode right mix
content: While experts believe that one investment strategy doesn‚Äôt work for everyone, and risk profile and time horizon play a crucial role, they are broadly in consensus on what a large part of your portfolio should look like.

title: IndiGo chaos: Over 200 flyers stuck for 5 hours in plane at Chennai airport
content: Over 200 IndiGo passengers faced a grueling 5-hour delay for their Singapore-bound flight from Chennai due to a cabin temperature issue and crew duty hour limitations. Passengers reported suffocation and lack of clear communication, with a viral video capturing their distress. An alternate crew was arranged, leading to the significant delay.

title: 'Puppet of foreign powers': BJP labels Rahul, Gandhi clan & Congress 'compromised'
content: Putting all the members of the Gandhi family, who have ruled the nation, in the dock, the Union minister said the clan never "shied away from compromising the country". He went further back to attack the Nehru-Gandhi family as he highlighted the infamous Bofors scandal that was widely reported during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure and had been the reason behind the fall of his government.

title: Nallakannu - a guiding light of simplicity, commitment and principled politics
content: R Nallakannu, who died in Chennai on Wednesday at the age of 101, represented a generation of leaders shaped by the freedom struggle and guided by ideological discipline rather than personal ambition

title: Justin Bieber spotted courtside as LeBron powers Lakers past Magic
content: LeBron James and popular music icon Justin Bieber were seen sharing a good time during a recent game between the Los Angeles Lakers and the Orlando Magic. The Grammy winner turned out to be the King's biggest cheerleader, as he was seen applauding and cheering at every shot of the NBA legend. However, with a massive Instagram following and being one of the biggest NBA stars, LeBron James' popularity needs no introduction.

title: Chaos at Azim Premji University: Police book Spark Reading Circle after ABVP protests Kashmir 'talk'
content: ABVP activists protested and vandalized Azim Premji University campus over a discussion on Kashmir atrocities. The university registrar filed a police complaint against Spark Reading Circle, accusing them of organizing the event without consent. Police arrested 25 ABVP activists, who were later granted bail.

title: T20 World Cup: On the backfoot, India's playing XI an unsolved puzzle
content: Following a disappointing loss against South Africa, the Indian cricket team faces a must-win scenario against Zimbabwe. Calls for adding a right-hander like Sanju Samson have intensified to counter predictable tactics, especially against off-spinners. Discussions are ongoing regarding potential changes to the playing XI to address tactical imbalances and improve performance.

title: Rinku Singh to rejoin India squad ahead of must-win clash vs Zimbabwe
content: Rinku Singh is set to rejoin the Indian squad this evening after a brief absence due to his father's ill health. The middle-order batter had returned home urgently, missing training sessions. His father is reportedly in serious condition in an NCR hospital. Singh's availability for the crucial Super 8 match against Zimbabwe was in doubt following his departure.

title: Infantino confident Mexico will host 2026 World Cup despite violence
content: FIFA president Gianni Infantino has expressed confidence that the FIFA World Cup 2026 in Mexico will go ahead smoothly despite recent deadly cartel violence. The tournament will be jointly hosted by Mexico, the United States and Canada from June 11 to July 19. His remarks came after violent unrest erupted in several Mexican states following a military operation that killed powerful cartel leader Nemesio ‚ÄúEl Mencho‚Äù Oseguera near Guadalajara.

title: Watch: Rs 30,000 bribe sting exposes Rs 4 cr cash hoard, gold & luxury house of Odisha mines officer
content: Odisha Vigilance officials seized over Rs 4 crore in unaccounted cash from the residence of arrested mines official Debabrata Mohanty. The deputy director of mines in Cuttack was apprehended accepting a Rs 30,000 bribe. This marks the highest-ever cash seizure in a trap case in the state, with further assets under investigation.

title: ‚ÄòPapa, main chaurahe par tha‚Äô: Was there a seat swap after Thar killed elderly tourist in Goa?
content: A 65-year-old tourist from Bhopal died after his car was hit by a speeding SUV at the Happy Bar junction in Assagao. Eyewitnesses allege occupants of the rented SUV attempted to switch seats after the collision. Police are investigating the incident, verifying claims of a driver cover-up.

title: Delhi HC: Right to perform last rites part of dignity protected under Article 21
content: The petition was filed under Article 226 of the Constitution of India read with Section 528 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023 (BNSS), seeking issuance of a writ of mandamus for emergency parole.

title: 'You cannot talk in that manner': Hafeez and Saqlain locked in tense exchange ‚Äì Watch
content: Tempers flared on live TV as former Pakistan stars Saqlain Mushtaq and Mohammad Hafeez clashed over Mohammad Nawaz's all-round capabilities following a crucial Super 8 defeat.  Pakistan's T20 World Cup hopes now hinge on their final match and favorable results, intensifying the debate about Nawaz's role as a batsman versus bowler.

title: 'Salim Khan is out of danger,' says Salman Khan's co-star Daisy Shah
content: Veteran screenwriter Salim Khan is recovering well after undergoing surgery for a minor brain haemorrhage. Actor Daisy Shah confirmed his stable condition, stating the surgery was successful and he is out of danger. The Khan family, however, expressed displeasure over the hospital's public medical bulletin, emphasizing their desire for privacy regarding his health.

title: Rs 25k cash reward for helping road accident victims: Delhi announces scheme
content: Delhi has launched the 'Rah-Veer' initiative, offering a Rs 25,000 cash reward and certificate to citizens who help seriously injured road accident victims. This scheme, part of a Central government program, aims to encourage prompt assistance during the critical 'golden hour' and reduce fears of legal complications. Annually, ten outstanding Rah-Veers will receive a Rs 1 lakh national award.

title: This engineer from Bihar chose to become a househusband, and why every man should read his story
content: Amit Kumar Dubey, a proud house husband from Bihar, has redefined traditional gender roles by dedicating himself to full-time household management. He gave up his job to support his wife, handling cooking, cleaning, and childcare. Despite occasional worries about his responsibilities as the eldest son, Amit finds fulfillment in his role, supported by his wife and family.

title: Catch a falling diamond! Indians wants solitaires as price falls by 30%
content: Diamond prices have dropped significantly, making solitaires more affordable and boosting demand among consumers aged 28-40. This trend, driven by improved affordability and a shift towards investment purchases, has led to a 25% year-on-year sales surge in the solitaire segment. Younger buyers are increasingly opting for diamond-studded jewelry over gold due to high gold prices.

title: CCTV captures speeding Ferrari crashing into vehicles in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills
content: A speeding Ferrari crashed into multiple vehicles in Jubilee Hills after allegedly suffering a mechanical failure, injuring five people. CCTV footage captured the luxury sports car swerving out of control, hitting an electric pole before colliding head-on with oncoming traffic. Police are investigating the incident, focusing on both driving conditions and suspected mechanical defects.

title: Mexico locals fear tourism hit before FIFA World Cup 2026
content: The killing of cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes in Mexico has raised fresh concerns about safety just months before the FIFA World Cup 2026. The operation took place near Tapalpa in Jalisco state. More than 70 people died during the military action and its aftermath. The violence has worried tourism businesses across the region.

title: Saudi Arabia bans poultry imports from 40 countries including India amid health concerns
content: Saudi Arabia has implemented extensive import bans on poultry and table eggs from 40 countries due to ongoing disease concerns, primarily avian influenza. An additional 16 nations face regional import restrictions. Exemptions are available for heat-treated products meeting strict health and certification requirements.

title: Ranji final explodes: J&K captain Paras Dogra headbutts Karnataka fielder ‚Äî watch
content: Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra headbutted a Karnataka substitute fielder during the Ranji Trophy final, sparking heated exchanges. Despite the incident and subsequent confrontations, Jammu and Kashmir continued to dominate, building on a strong first innings performance.

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 draft class will get picked in April.

title: Top NFL prospect Reese says he's an OLB/edge
content: Ohio State star Arvell Reese, one of the top prospects in April's NFL draft, declared himself an "outside linebacker/edge" rusher during media interviews at the combine Wednesday.

title: Jags, Commanders host teams for London games
content: The Jaguars and Commanders will be the host teams for the NFL's three London games in 2026, the league announced Wednesday morning.

title: Sources: Aubrey pushes for bigger Cowboys offer
content: The Cowboys have extended an offer to Brandon Aubrey that would make him the highest-paid kicker in the NFL, sources told ESPN, but Aubrey's agent has asked for a deal closer to $10 million per season.

title: Hellebuyck set for Medal of Freedom, Trump says
content: Connor Hellebuyck, the goaltender for the gold-medal-winning U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, President Donald Trump announced during Tuesday night's State of the Union.

title: Botched final play sees Luka hesitate, LeBron miss
content: The Lakers lost to the Magic 110-109 on Tuesday after a botched sidelines out-of-bounds play between LeBron James and Luka Doncic in the final seconds failed to produce a quality shot.

title: Boozer goes off as Duke beats Notre Dame by 44
content: Cameron Boozer had 24 points and 13 rebounds as No. 1 Duke beat Notre Dame 100-56 on Tuesday night, handing the Irish their worst home loss since 1898.

title: Source: Kyler hasn't talked to Cards, refuting GM
content: Cardinals general manager Monti Ossenfort said he has spoken with quarterback Kyler Murray, but a source told ESPN that the two have not talked since the end of the season.

title: Lynch believes 49ers, Williams 'on the same page'
content: Shortly after ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Tuesday that left tackle Trent Williams and the 49ers are "struggling to find a contractual solution," general manager John Lynch offered a more optimistic perspective.

title: üîÆ Predicting '28 Olympics U.S. men's hoops team
content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Who will start at quarterback for the Vikings, Browns and Jets? We made QB1 predictions for all 32 teams
content: Will Kirk Cousins go back to Minnesota? Could Kyler Murray join the AFC? Let's predict who will start for every team in the 2026 season.

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: Men's Bracketology: Duke's ascension to No. 1 overall was inevitable
content: It was only a matter of time until a path opened for the Blue Devils, who ride their win over Michigan to the top.

content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

content: Do any fast-rising young outfielders beat out these two New York sluggers on our top 10? Let's find out.

title: Ranking the top 10 shortstops in MLB this season
content: Buster Olney's ranking of the top players at every position turns to the premier infield position: shortstop.

title: Freshmen facing pressure in 2026
content: With big money and big expectations, first-year players such as five-stars Jared Curtis and Jackson Cantwell have work ahead.

title: They're back! Key returning players for every top 25 team
content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

title: 'Oh god! Who built this?': The origin of the WWE Elimination Chamber
content: At the 2002 Survivor Series, six WWE superstars entered the Elimination Chamber. We look back at that night.

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Coaching carousel: Who's on the hot seat? Who are the names to watch?
content: The schools (Oklahoma? Syracuse?), names (Will Wade? Porter Moser? Josh Schertz?) and buzz we're tracking.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Missouri gets promoted up the SEC pecking order
content: The Tigers have a much easier case for one of the SEC's 10 or 11 bids after defeating Tennessee on Tuesday.

title: Champions League's biggest upsets: Bodo/Glimt join list of giant killers
content: Norwegian minnows Bodo/Glimt pulled off one of the biggest Champions League upsets ever by eliminating Inter. Here are 10 more major shocks.

title: How to bet the Cognizant Classic in The Palm Beaches: Two bets stand out
content: The next stop on the PGA Tour season brings us to West Palm Beach, Florida, in a tournament that rewards those who can avoid the big numbers.

title: Premier League overreactions: Spurs to get relegated? Chelsea to set poor discipline record?
content: Let's overreact to the latest fixtures of a potentially epic Premier League season, from Spurs' dire straits to Chelsea's shot at unwanted history.

title: How do Shakhtar keep signing so many Brazilians amid ongoing Ukraine conflict?
content: The flow of Brazilian players to Shakhtar Donetsk hasn't stopped since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began.

title: NFL free agency tiers: Barnwell ranks the best QBs, RBs, WRs, TEs and OL
content: NFL free agency is almost here, and we placed players on offense into tiers based on their potential offseason contracts. Who could get paid?

title: Boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Bivol, Beterbiev out; who replaces them?
content: Dmitry Bivol and Artur Beterbiev are out of the top 10 for inactivity. Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Divisional rankings: Ryan Garcia enters welterweight top five
content: A masterful title fight performance from Garcia earns him a WBC belt and a spot among the welterweight elite.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Pickups: Pick up Melton, Wallace and Raynaud for the homestretch
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Pickups: Why Dostal, Laferriere are post-Olympics must-adds
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: CM unveils IRIA, says Kerala leads India in holistic Ayurveda research
content: The Chief Minister underscores the need to recognise and collaborate with skilled traditional healers, whose experiential knowledge can strengthen young researchers

title: Ahead of Kerala Assembly polls, Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala steps up community connect, party sees strategic role
content: Chennithala visits  headquarters of Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church and Nair Service Society in Kottayam

title: Milk adulteration in A.P.: 15 persons still critical, toxicology reports awaited
content: The milk and ghee samples are being tested in VIMTA laboratory, Hyderabad and Food Testing Laboratory in JNTU-Kakinada

title: How Modi‚Äôs Israel trip could impact India‚Äôs West Asia relations
content: The Prime Minister‚Äôs visit will help deepen engagement with Tel Aviv, going far beyond routine diplomacy

title: Stalin to lay foundation for Mini TIDEL Parks in Erode, Tirunelveli, Virudhunagar districts on February 26
content: These parks offer space of about 60,000 sq.ft. and are designed to foster growth, support startups, and create jobs for around 600 IT professionals in each location

title: Delhi High Court dismisses PIL over information on Ahmedabad plane crash
content: The court terms it ‚Äòhighly misconceived‚Äô; the petitioner urged the court that the preliminary probe report of Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) should include details on the ‚Äòcomplete sequence of events‚Äô that led to the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad last June

title: CMO rebuffs Chennithala‚Äôs accusation on data leak
content: CMO says  data collection spearheaded by the State‚Äôs IT Mission is a precursor to the creation of a centralised notification hub for government services

title: Call to check safety rule violations in granite quarries
content: The immediate trigger for the renewed protests was an incident at Thottumukkam on February 22 in which two residents sustained injuries after broken pieces of granite stones fell on them following a blast at a nearby quarry

title: Watch: Renaming West Bengal: Mamata alleges bias after Centre clears ‚ÄòKeralam‚Äô
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has accused the Union Government of ignoring repeated proposals to rename West Bengal as ‚ÄòBangla‚Äô, hours after the Union Cabinet approved Kerala‚Äôs renaming as ‚ÄòKeralam‚Äô.

title: Building collapse: stern action against those responsible for lapses
content: The structural stability of buildings in Kozhikode city should be examined seriously by the Corporation, he says

title: Demand for Dalit CM natural, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: Stating that it does not mean Siddaramaiah should be unseated, he says that there is nothing wrong in fresh MLAs seeking Cabinet berths

title: A.P. Cabinet clears projects worth ‚Çπ980 crore in Amaravati
content: Administrative sanctions given for critical mechanical, electrical and plumbing works in the Assembly and High Court buildings in Amaravati

title: Courts now justify environment degradation: former Supreme Court judge
content: Referring to decisions such as clean chit to Vantara and allowing the great Nicobar project, Justice Deepak Gupta says the role of courts does not end in just seeing if the procedure has been followed

title: KWA to launch pilot tourism project with guest houses in Idukki
content: Guest houses come up attached to KWA‚Äôs overhead water tanks in Cheruthoni and Painavu in Idukki, which are set to open for tourists soon

title: Women ridership increased to 65% under free bus scheme, says A.P. Minister
content: An average of 25 lakh women commute in public transport daily under the ‚ÄòStree Shakti‚Äô initiative, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: ‚ÄòOperation TRACE‚Äô helped detect 4,600 missing women, minor girls in A.P., says Home Minister
content: Operation TRACE has streamlined case registration, investigation, and follow-up, with teams operating at district and State levels, says Anitha

title: No evidence of KSU workers attacking Health Minister Veena George: Satheesan
content: He says United Democratic Front will continue its black-flag protests against the Minister and the Communist Party of India (Marxist)‚Äôs threats of violence will not deter the Opposition

title: Frame guidelines for financial recovery from officials, Lokayukta tells Kerala government
content: State government asked to issue a government order or an office memorandum within two months laying down guidelines regulating the recovery of excess payments made to government officials

title: Nehru-Gandhi family has always put politics above country: Madhya Pradesh CM
content: At a farmers' rally in Bhopal on February 24, Rahul Gandhi had alleged that the Modi government approved the trade deal under pressure

title: Biritsh Raj's Unpaid Bill: Family Demands Rs 35,000 Borrowed 100 Years Ago
content: The British Empire once prided itself on being the realm where the sun never set. But in the quiet town of Sehore in Madhya Pradesh, a forgotten piece of paper suggests that even the mighty Empire once needed a sunrise loan from a wealthy local.

title: 'Like Mujibur Rahman': Congress After Nehru Statue Pulled Down In Assam
content: A 10-foot statue of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, was pulled down by unidentified vandals at Pailapool in Assam's Cachar district.

title: PM Modi Israel visit LIVE: PM Modi Says "Extremely Honoured" To Be Received By Netanyahu
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: 6,800 km From Epstein Island, His Paris Lair Surfaces With Disturbing Details
content: The photographs show an 18-room residence saturated in red, orange and pink tones. Walls are covered with framed images of naked or semi-naked young women.

title: On Camera, Suicide Bomber Blows Himself Up Near Pak Checkpost, 4 Cops Dead
content: A suicide attack took place near a checkpost in Pakistan's Bhakkar district at 7pm on Tuesday. Two police personnel were killed in the explosion, while four others were injured.

title: 25,000 Students, Zero Teachers: Madhya Pradesh State Universities Sit Empty
content: The university is currently running undergraduate courses in agriculture, arts, commerce, and science, along with a postgraduate commerce program, but it is functioning entirely on temporary arrangements.

title: She Left For Christmas Shopping, Then Disappeared For 24 Years. Until Now
content: A North Carolina mom of three disappeared over 24 years ago when she supposedly left her home in Eden to do Christmas shopping at a Kmart in Virginia.

title: "Creative Freedom": Centre Backs Censor Certificate To Kerala Story 2
content: The government has backed the Film board certification to the sequel to 'Kerala Story" - the film that has landed in controversy after the release of its trailer - saying the film "does not threaten public order".

title: Opinion: Opinion | From Kerala To Keralam: What's Really In A Name? A Lot, Apparently
content: For many, the name change may be much ado about nothing, but for the likes of MN Karassery, who have been using Keralam instead of Kerala over the years, it is a moment to celebrate.

title: How David Headley's Fake Mumbai Office Masked The 26/11 Plot
content: David Coleman Headley, who is serving a 35-year sentence in the US, operated a fake immigration office in Mumbai as part of a larger conspiracy behind the 2008 terror attacks, a supplementary chargesheet filed by anti-terror agency NIA said.

title: Why PM Modi's Israel Visit Is Being Seen As A Strategic Turning Point
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel on February 25 is being widely viewed as a milestone moment in India-Israel relations, underscoring growing strategic trust, deepening economic cooperation.

title: How India's Diplomacy In West Asia Ended Its Era As A Silent Observer
content: Historically, India maintained a relatively quiet profile in West Asia, often viewed as a passive observer. However, today, this dynamic has shifted dramatically.

title: 'Killed For Rs 20,000, ISI Behind It': Punjab Police On 2 Cops Shot Dead
content: The killing of the two policemen near the India and Pakistan border in Punjab's Gurdaspur was carried out by Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), a senior police official said Wednesday.

title: "Don't Paint Us As Delhi's Darinde Couple": Accused In Delhi Racial Abuse Case
content: Harsh Singh, who hurled racist abuses along with his wife at three Northeastern women living in Delhi's Malviya Nagar, has said they are "ashamed" and apologised to the people of the Northeast

title: Karnataka Mobile Shop Owner Stabbed After Dispute Over Rs 100 Screen Guard
content: A man allegedly stabbed a mobile shop owner following an argument over a screen guard replacement in Karnataka's Chitradurga district on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Israel Once Defied Its Biggest Ally To Secretly Help India Against Pakistan
content: During the 1971 India-Pakistan war, Israel secretly supplied India with critical military equipment despite the absence of formal diplomatic ties. Then came an 'offer' against Pakistan in the 1980s.

title: Labour Unrest At Indian Oil's Panipat Refinery, Work Stops Amid Clashes
content: Tension at the Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) refinery in Panipat continued for the third consecutive day on Wednesday as contract labourers intensified their protest, leading to clashes with the police.

title: SIM-Binding Rules Won't Change, Security Comes First: Jyotiraditya Scindia
content: The government's decision on SIM-binding rules will not change because security issues are more important on national interest grounds than matters linked to revenue implications, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said today.

title: Inside Mumbai's Worsening Air Pollution Crisis
content: Mumbai woke up to yet another blanket of haze on Tuesday morning, with a grey veil hanging over the skyline from Bandra to South Mumbai.

title: Nallakannu to be accorded state honours: Stalin
content: ‚ÄúLet it [the life of the veteran CPI leader] be our guiding light. The memory and fame of comrade R. Nallakannu, who lived his life for the proletarians, would remain in the minds of people,‚Äù Mr. Stalin said.

title: Nandyal MP nominated to India-German Parliamentary panel
content: The opportunity to serve the nation at the global level would be used to strengthen parliamentary cooperation and deepen bilateral ties between India and Germany, says Byreddy Sabari

title: Original Vande Mataram tune is a fusion of raga and qawwali: Sulekha ink makers
content: A collector‚Äôs set to mark 150 years of the national song Vande Mataram features a limited edition box of special and vintage items, including an illustrated booklet

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: CM Pinarayi condemns KSU attack on Veena George; CPI(M), LDF, SFI call for Statewide protests
content: Health Minister Veena George suffered injuries on neck and head as a result of physical assault by KSU activists

title: Group-I recruitment: A.P. HC gives Chief Secretary 24 hours to comply with order
content: Division Bench warns of contempt proceedings unless its order dated February 11 is carried out and a compliance report filed by 10.30 a.m. on February 26

title: D.K. Shivakumar bats for replacement of old guard by fresh faces in Karnataka Cabinet
content: Deputy CM  Shivakumar‚Äôs suggestion to induct fresh faces assumes significance in the backdrop of recent letter penned by legislators to Congress high command

content: The two-day celebration of literature and ideas will bring together writers, poets, and artists from across India

content: Earlier, the DMK had asked the Congress leadership to be ready for talks on February 26 or 27. However, as of now, there is no confirmation of a date

content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) told a bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta that there were materials, including inflammatory videos and incriminating e-mails, against Shabir Ahmed Shah

title: ED attaches Mumbai property worth ‚Çπ3,716 crore linked to Anil Ambani

title: A.P. Minister highlights strategic push to titanium, rare-earth sectors

title: Meghalaya Health Minister says State has highest HIV caseload in India
content: Health Minister Wailadmiki Shylla told the Assembly that 10,293 people living with HIV in the State were receiving antiretroviral therapy

title: Eurasian diving duck in Kaziranga triggers climate change concern
content: The 7th waterbird count across the wetlands in the one-horned rhino domain yielded 105,540 birds belonging to 107 species; an ornithologist says the vagrant status of smew flags climate-driven range shifts and the need to protect refuelling stops amid hunting and oil pollution threats

title: Tourist from Bhopal killed as SUV driven by youth hits car in Goa
content: Bhagatram Sharma (65) suffered serious injuries when a Mahindra Thar driven by Shaurya Goyal, a Delhi resident, hit one side of the hatchback carrying him and his family

title: Deaths of 41 tigers recorded in Maharashtra in 2025: Minister
content: The government is intensifying efforts to curb the deaths of tigers due to accidents, electrocution, and poaching, says State Forest Minister Ganesh Naik

title: Stray dog beaten to death; case registered under BNS and PCA Act
content: The accused are alleged to have unlawfully assembled with the intention of committing the offence and attacked the dog using a wooden stick causing fatal injuries

title: Mysuru silk saree production may be hit as protest intensifies against stadium at KSIC filature factory at T. Narsipura, weaving staff stay away from work
content: Around 700 workers of the Mysuru weaving unit, 150 from Channapatna and nearly 190 from the filature factory stayed away from duty, disrupting operations, and raising concerns over the potential impact on the production of GI-tagged Mysuru silk sarees

title: No development funds on priority for villages without cremation grounds: Minister
content: In a written reply to a question regarding an incident at Patewadi in Ahilyanagar district, the tribal woman's body was taken to a government office due to a dispute about where the last rites should be conducted. Minister said the government has launched a special drive to resolve such issues

title: Modi‚Äôs Israel visit: Balancing strategic ties amid West Bank tensions

title: Sasikala‚Äôs entry ahead of T.N. Assembly polls may aggravate AIADMK‚Äôs woes

title: Kerala Health Minister Veena George injured during KSU protest in Kannur

title: Former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren‚Äôs grandson dies in Manali

title: Does Sam Altman think humans are batteries?
content: Nirmalya Dutta is an editorial consultant with The Times of India. He covers world news, pop culture, and philosophical memes. He writes the column Random Musings and The Weekly Vine, a newsletter that blends news, culture, and humour with a touch of chaos. He is also the co-creator of Meow Times, a satirical cartoon strip about the absurdities of corporate life. His political, moral, and economic views drift somewhere between woke-Leninist, Rand-Marxist, and Keynesian-Friedmanite, though he isn‚Äôt entirely sure what any of those terms mean. Read More

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact
content: the heavyweight division is seriously lacking in depth and activity at the top . the fight ended prematurely as a no-contest after he suffered eye pokes that required surgery and threaten to end his career . it's not going to stay in a valley forever, but MMA fans will await that day eagerly .

title: Week 3 Top 25 and how to watch
content: Sophia Knight was named SEC Player of the Week after going 11-for-13 last week . she has recorded eight multi-hit games and is hitting .543 through the first 14 games of the season . here is the complete scoreboard here to stay up to date this spring .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Razorbacks beat the Musketeers 7-6 in a road series against Tennessee . the Vols dropped seven spots to no. 20 in this week's rankings . they're facing the top team in the country in UCLA on Friday .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: 2026 MLB lineup rankings: Which teams have the best bats in baseball?
content: Hall of Famer Rogers Hornsby uttered a romantic quote . "people ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball," he said . he swaps cards from team to team, envisioning what the next summer would look like .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Will the Wolves rise? Where all 30 teams land after All-Star break
content: the race for the playoffs is heating up in the East and the West . the team are neck and neck with the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder . but things could catch up to the Thunder because of injuring a player .

title: Trade grades: What can Brett Kulak do for the Avalanche?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season continues now that the Olympics and the Olympic roster freeze are over . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights in exchange for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud .

title: What's next for the 10 worst teams: Evaluating draft, free agency and trade options
content: the postseason picture is becoming clearer for teams at the bottom of the standings looking to turn the page . the 2025-26 NBA regular season is approaching the end of the regular season . a top-five pick in June's draft could build on their championship aspirations .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .
